result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Cases called at 4:20 PM - 22CF41 and 22CF161)
Defendant Damien R Georgeson appeared by video, in custody, from Dodge Correctional Institution.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Damien R Georgeson.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant inquires about Challenge Incarceration Program eligibility. (2:14 PM cases 22CF41, 22CF161 called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Damien R Georgeson in court. Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Damien R Georgeson. 
Parties advise are ready to proceed.
State requests to proceed with case 22CF41 first.
22CF41: 
State calls Investigator Wayne Bjorkman of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Hillestad conducts cross-examination of Investigator Bjorkman. Witness excused.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over for an Arraignment.
22CF161:
State calls Sergeant Brandon Ring of the Eau Claire County Sheriff's Department, who is sworn and testifies.
State requests the Court take judicial notice of the bond in Eau Claire County case 22CF41, no objection by Attorney Hillestad. Court takes judicial notice of the bond in Eau Claire County case 22CF41.
Attorney Hillestad conducts cross-examination of Sergeant Ring. Witness excused.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over for an Arraignment.
Attorney Hillestad to schedule Arraignment on cases 22CF41, 22CF161 with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.
